job_description: Based in Richmond, VAThe LIUNA Mid-Atlantic Regional Organizing Coalition of the Laborers’ International Union of North America (LiUNA!), the premier union in the building trades, is seeking a dedicated and creative Organizer to help our union organizing campaigns.LiUNA! Mid-Atlantic is dedicated to providing family-sustaining wages and benefits to working families. For more than 100 years, LiUNA! has worked hard to build and serve America, as well as to preserve and increase living standards, respect, and safety for our members. Please apply today and join a dynamic and dedicated team fighting for working families.KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES● Conducting broad and intensive outreach efforts to low-wage workers.● Building one-on-one relationships with workers.● Identifying and developing leaders to guide and lead campaigns.● Conducting individual/group meetings with workers to discuss and plan organizing campaigns.● Motivating individual workers and groups of workers to take action.● Engaging workers in broader union efforts to bring pressure to bear on industry sectors.● Coordinating with workers to gather information that is useful in identifying opportunities for membership growth and mobilization.● Working to involve community allies in organizing campaigns.● Other duties as assignedJOB REQUIREMENTS● A car and a valid driver’s license are required.● Willingness to work long and irregular hours, including nights and weekends.● Willingness to conduct house visits and site visits.● Previous experience in union or community organizing is desirable.● Knowledge of the construction industry is desirable.Salary: Commensurate with experience; all qualified candidates are strongly encouraged to apply; Competitive Benefit Package IncludedJob Type: Full-timePay: $48,000.00 - $55,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insuranceProfessional development assistanceVision insuranceExperience:Union Organizing: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: On the road

Job Description
This position is responsible for consultation pertaining to LR/HR practices and policies for assigned client groups or specific discipline. The responsibilities could include consultation on the portfolio of HR programs and initiatives or acting as a subject matter expert for an HR discipline with the intent to ensure maximum effectiveness of the Human Resources function.

Overview:

Our Orlando office is looking for a Policy Planning Analyst with 2+ years of experience to join our Planning team.
Responsibilities:

This position will support our growing planning practices which includes public policy planning, community planning, public outreach, and other areas of the planning field. A technical knowledge of planning principles is required along with the ability to effectively write reports and similar planning documents. The ability to work closely with the public, stakeholders, and various agency staff is also required.
Project experiences will be diverse, as we provide services to both the public and private sectors. You will perform a variety of tasks, supporting various project managers and collaborating with team members. Responsibilities may include:
Preparing planning and land use studies and varied technical memos
Drafting comprehensive plan update
Drafting Land Development code updates
Processing private land development entitlements
Performing zoning, land use, and evaluation
Organizing and attending community and public outreach meetings, including attending evening meetings when needed
Project management: managing tasks and submittal coordination
Coordinating with various municipal and State agencies
Qualifications:
Degree (Bachelor's or Master's) in Urban and Regional Planning, or other degree applicable to the planning field
2+ years of work experience in a related field, and internships are preferred
Experience with planning for mixed-used environments, New Urbanism/Smart Growth principles, public agencies, land use analysis, community engagement, and knowledge of progressive planning trends and strategies
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational skills
Working knowledge of Esri ArcGIS software (ArcMap/ArcGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online)
Positive attitude and a strong work ethic
Strong sense of urgency and self-initiative to meet client deadlines
Detail-oriented team player with an ability to contribute to a positive work environment
Ability to work independently and as a team
Ability to commute to local municipalities and job sites
**Writing samples and/or cartography portfolio may be requested if considered for an interview**

Shangri-La Industries is seeking a Legal Assistant to join our team at our Los Angeles Headquarters to support in-house counsel in all facets of its general contracting, real estate, and subcontracting businesses.
Shangri-La Industries (SLI) was formed 14 years ago by principals with considerable experience in the ownership and operation of real estate to address the typical shortcomings experienced in the industry. Today it is a privately-held, vertically integrated group of firms focused on excellence in multi-family housing and hospitality facilities. As the parent corporation of three leading businesses in the California AEC industry, Shangri-La Development, Shangri-La Construction, and World Mechanical, Inc., SLI delivers across a spectrum of real estate specialties efficiently and cost-effectively.

Reports To: General Counsel

Works With: Department Leaders, Risk Management Administrator

Supervises: N/A

POSITION SUMMARY
The Legal Assistant provides essential support to in-house counsel in all facets of its business, including real estate transactions and management, construction, insurance, and overall company risk management. The Legal Assistant is a detail-oriented individual with strong organizational and communication skills who effectively manages multiple tasks and deadlines. Responsibilities include assisting with litigation and compliance, tracking various corporate deadlines, organizing items of corporate governance, contract administration, and general administrative tasks and special projects. The Legal Assistant liaises with clients, partners, consultants, and staff, ensuring clear and professional communication and commitment to maintaining strict confidentiality and adhering to ethical standards.

KEY DUTIES
Work closely with General Counsel on managing litigation and compliance matters.
Track legal, licensing, and general corporate deadlines.
Assist General Counsel with litigation, loan diligence, and development of company standard operating procedures.
Organize and maintain entities, licenses, and items of corporate governance.
Maintain the Corporate Calendar.
Put together and summarize basic contracts, including settlements, purchase and sale agreements, construction contracts, etc.
Ensure contracts and all items related to the legal department are properly and timely negotiated and drafted to reflect the company's acceptable legal, business, and technical terms.
Manage and conduct the referral, tracking, and execution of high-volume asset management and financial lender matters, ensuring compliance with all lender and stakeholder control procedures.
Review, interpret and maintain various databases and spreadsheets on a rapid and time-sensitive basis to ensure applicable information is included for legal referrals.
Coordinate execution of asset management documents by the legal department.
Maintain and update legal project status chart, including filing emails to appropriate areas and following up on inquiries, requests, and points of clarification.
Keep track of and manage the company insurance portfolio and any related claims.
Participate in general administrative tasks, support to the legal department, and various special projects, as assigned.
SKILLS & EXPERTISE
Understanding of legal terminology, procedures, and the basics of various areas of law preferred.
Strong research skills to support General Counsel in preparing cases, drafting documents, or advising clients.
Ability to draft various types of documents, including correspondence, legal memos, and case summaries.
Highly organized and able to prioritize workload to ensure that tasks are completed accurately and on time.
Detail-oriented to ensure work is thorough and error-free.
Ability to adhere to strict ethical standards and always maintain confidentiality.
Ability to adapt to changing circumstances, learn new skills, and handle various tasks as needed.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other productivity tools.
Understanding of legal practice management and document management systems preferred.
LEADERSHIP & COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Ability to actively listen.
Clear and concise verbal communication to convey complex information accurately and professionally.
Strong written communication skills to produce clear, well-organized, and error-free documents.
Strong interpersonal skills to establish rapport and maintain positive working relationships with others.
Emotional intelligence for effective communication, particularly during challenging or high-pressure situations.
Active reading skills, including taking notes and highlighting key information to interpret and communicate content.
Ability to effectively present information clearly and engagingly.
EDUCATION
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as business administration, legal studies, real estate, or construction preferred.
EXPERIENCE
2+ years of related experience.
Real estate transactions and construction experience preferred.
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
Competitive salary, performance incentive, and growth opportunity.
Medical/dental/vision insurance (Shangri-La covers 100% of the cost for employees and 50% for dependents).
Basic & Voluntary Life/AD&D Insurance.
Flex Spending Account (FSA) option.
401K Retirement Plan (up to the first 3% of your eligible compensation).
PTO accruals up to 15 days annual.
Paid holidays ~10 days annual.
FlexWork Program (up to 2 days/week remote work).
Cellphone reimbursement.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The position primarily includes work in an office atmosphere with periods of work outdoor. Performance of the duties requires the physical ability to sit for long periods at a desk frequently; stand, walk, and climb stairs; continuously verbally communicate; view information using close and peripheral vision and depth perception with the ability to adjust focus; repetitively use hands to keyboard and operate office productivity machinery. The position occasionally requires stooping, kneeling, and lifting to 25 pounds. The noise level in the environment is usually moderate.
This is a general statement of required primary duties and responsibilities and does not exclude other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Shangri-La is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Shangri-La Construction, LP is AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

The position responsibilities, tasks and duties may differ from the position description and other duties, as assigned, may be part of the position.

JOB DESCRIPTION
WHO WE ARE
Michael Baker International is a global leader in Engineering, Architecture and Consulting services dedicated to developing and implementing innovative solutions to the world’s infrastructure, environmental challenges, and governmental. Supported by more than 3,500 employees in 90 offices worldwide, we provide a full continuum of life-cycle engineering consulting, specialized global construction, base operations, Green Infrastructure, security management and intelligence solutions.
The Consulting and Technology Solutions (CTS) vertical of Michael Baker International partners with federal, state, regional and local governments including broadband and telecommunications agencies and companies, Department of Defense, Airport Corporations, Oil and Gas industry, and natural resource agencies to provide unrivaled expertise in the application of new and emerging technologies to solve their greatest challenges. We seamlessly integrate advanced technology into service delivery, providing clients with a 360-degree view of their assets and program. We enable more informed, faster and more accurate decisions to be made with greater confidence.
Thought leadership, technological innovation, and differentiated service are all synonymous of the Michael Baker International’s CTS brand.
DESCRIPTION – Broadband Strategy and Policy Analyst
Michael Baker International is seeking a qualified Broadband Strategy and Policy Analyst to join Michael Baker’s CTS team. This is an opportunity to work within a dynamic and growing industry and with one of the leading broadband mapping, planning, and program management services firm in the nation. We’ve built a team of people who desire being part of a dynamic unit delivering broadband solutions for federal, state, regional, and local governments through innovative ideas and client advocacy.
Broadband consulting services represents a growing market need across the US. Within the CTS Team, this position will be the vital link to ensure our broadband technology solutions are aligned with client’s goals. Strategy and policy development at Michael Baker occur throughout the whole life cycle of project implementation from kick-off to final delivery. Acting as a client advocate and trusted advisor and supported by our expert technical team and world class software solutions, the Broadband Strategy and Policy Analyst serve as a Broadband subject matter expert, evaluate client needs both for short term improvement and long-term sustainability of their broadband programs, provide guidance and leadership involving best practices for project performance measurements, implementation and deployment, policy impacts and recommendations from local to federal levels, and track applicability and timelines of funding streams.
Role Summary:
Under the direction of the National Broadband Digital Equity Director, this role will be responsible for developing broadband strategy solutions for clients and building relationships related to broadband planning and program management. Collaborate with project managers and technical team members to performing client briefings, presentations, analyses, and other forms of communication with clients. Support project managers in executing and/or reviewing data deliverables, preparing funding and grant strategies, and guiding policy recommendations. Day to day problem solving with both clients and internal program staff on broadband project deliverables with an eye on solutions that are achievable and compliant with state and federal regulations. The role may support developing and securing new customers. Deploy innovative technology solutions alongside our team of software developers, GIS, communications, and graphic arts teams that advance Michael Baker’s broadband and overall CTS offerings.
This role involves substantial leadership opportunities, leading project tasks and working with team members to meet schedules and prepare high-quality deliverables. This role will also have the flexibility to pursue innovative approaches and develop ways to expand our broadband services in ways that fit the successful applicant’s interests and skills. This role and the CTS team as a whole are oriented towards innovative solutions for consulting and technology that can further advance the full suite of services and industry sectors offered by Michael Baker International to positively impact communities nationwide. Growth opportunities to advance into project management or other technical lead positions are amply supported.
Essential Functions:
Develop and define best practices related to broadband expansion and digital equity for existing and prospective clients. This may include developing the framework for feasibility studies, strategic roadmaps, and 5-year action plans under the BEAD program.
Assemble funding strategies and advise on grant applications for projects, from broadband infrastructure to digital equity programming
Guide policy recommendations at local, state, and federal levels regarding equitable expansion practices, business models, fostering competition, and more.
Performing needs assessments, market research and public outreach to gain an understanding of digital access and equity needs in a client’s given geography
Engage with clients and prospective clients on-site and virtually to advise them on best practices and MBI’s broadband services
Utilize platforms such as conferences, panels, public testimony, and other public events to discuss broadband funding and deployment strategies
Be the conduit to identify private sector partners that are a best fit for government clients to develop public-private partnerships or other synergies related to broadband connectivity
Develop reports for final delivery and inclusion with broadband studies and roadmap plans
Guide the development of educational materials regarding such topics as economic impacts and policy impacts of broadband projects, alongside Michael Baker’s communications and graphic arts team
Elevate the profile of Michael Baker’s broadband team by building a strong report with the broadband community and maintain a high profile
Support other disciplines that have existing client relationships and leverages those relationships in search of growth opportunities
Assist clients to identify funding and procurement options, including those related to ARPA, IIJA, and other regional funding mechanisms
Develop client leads and assist team project managers to prepare effective project proposals and contracts in cooperation with project managers
Provide support regarding geospatial data and use of Michael Baker’s Connectivity Platform products
Ability to travel on-site to meet with clients or prospective clients; estimated 20% of work may include travel
Ability to attend occasional evening meetings as needed to suit client schedules or team schedules that cross time zones
Competencies and Skills:
Solid understanding of broadband funding streams, policies, and regulations.
Familiarity with IIJA BEAD and DEA program requirements
Preference for knowledge of the operational workflows involved in broadband program management.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Ability to translate technical concepts into layman’s terms
Ability to coordinate with project stakeholders
Ability to work on multiple projects at a given time
Organized and capable of leading tasks that must collaborate with multiple team members
Ability to maintain task schedules and meet deadlines
Experience Required:
5+ years of broadband planning, grant support, and/or policy development for community agencies, telecom providers, broadband offices, and/or nonprofits
Strong analytical abilities, solid analytical and trouble-shooting skills with the ability to quickly identify and solve client issues
Proven leadership experience managing tasks and team members
Experience in working with and understanding Broadband technologies and infrastructure
Experience in working with and understanding Broadband funding streams and related government policies
Computer and software skills (Microsoft Office) to develop reports, guide clients virtually, and develop presentations that are professional and clearly understood
Historical knowledge of federal, statewide, and regional broadband programs is a strong plus.
Experience Preferred:
8+ years of broadband planning, grant writing, and/or policy development for community agencies, broadband offices, and/or nonprofit
Bachelor’s Degree in Planning, Communications, Public Policy, Business, Geography/GIS, Engineering, Information Management, Computer Science, or relevant field
Economic planning and/or grant writing experience is a plus
AICP or similar/relevant credentials are a plus
Data visualization and analysis skills are a plus. Some use of Adobe Illustrator or other graphic mapping tools is beneficial.
COMPENSATION :

The salary range for this position is $90,000 to $120,0000, depending on the experience and expertise of the incoming candidate.
LOCATION : REMOTE

Job Type

Description
HELIX Environmental Planning, Inc. (HELIX), a growing, California-based employee-owned environmental consulting firm, is currently seeking as-needed archaeologists for our Cultural Resources group in southern California for work based in Los Angeles, Orange, and Riverside Counties. HELIX is a full-service environmental firm providing cultural resources, biological, landscape architecture, regulatory permitting, acoustical, air quality, habitat restoration, and GIS services to public and private clients across a variety of sectors.
As-Needed Archaeologist responsibilities consist of archaeological construction monitoring, record keeping, and communication with HELIX staff. Additional responsibilities may include records searches and background research, field surveys, excavation (testing and data recovery), lab work (cleaning, sorting, and cataloging artifacts), assistance with report writing, and Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR) 523 form preparation. Candidates must be comfortable with strenuous hiking and working in remote/desert areas with high heat conditions, sometimes for extended periods; be knowledgeable of the archaeology and culture history of southern California; be self-motivated and possess strong organizational, interpersonal, and verbal communication skills. Candidates must have reliable transportation with a valid California Driver’s License, be willing to work independently as well as with on-site construction and tribal personnel, and have a positive attitude. Projects are located throughout southern California, especially San Diego, Riverside, San Bernardino, Orange, and Los Angeles counties.
Please provide a detailed resume or curriculum vitae demonstrating your project experience and how you meet this position’s requirements and additional skills.
Hourly wages will be based on qualifications and/or experience. Expected starting pay range of $20 to $32 per hour.
HELIX is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and an inclusive work environment. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, disability, age, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service or veteran status. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring, appraisal systems, promotions, training, and career development programs.
PM21

Requirements
Minimum Requirements for As-Needed Archaeologist:
Must be currently enrolled in (or have previously completed) college-level classes in anthropology, archaeology, history of California, or closely related field, or equivalent experience
Demonstrated experience conducting archaeological fieldwork that may include survey, excavation, in-field analysis, and documentation
Knowledge of the archaeology and cultural history of southern California
Ability to identify artifacts and cultural features
Possess a valid California Driver’s License and 3 years clean driving record
Ability to do strenuous hiking and work full days in remote/desert areas
Demonstrate strong written/verbal communication skills
Additional skills considered a plus for Archaeologist:
Bachelor's Degree or higher in anthropology, archaeology, history, or closely related field, or equivalent experience
Professional cultural resources management experience in southern California archaeology
Experience with artifact cataloging and analysis
Experience preparing DPR forms
Experience with GPS equipment
Willingness to travel and stay overnight
Willingness to perform night work (projects starting at 5pm or later)
HAZWOPER training/certification
Railway/roadway safety training/certification

Position Overview:

ZENETEX is a rapidly growing, energetic, and win-focused enterprise supporting Federal government, military, and civilian agencies. We have corporate offices located in Washington, DC, Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, Oklahoma, New Jersey, and California. We are an organization committed to growth and shared success for all stakeholders; we are customer-driven, mission focused, and operate with integrity and trust in all relationships.
Zenetex is seeking a part time 30 hour per week Research Assistants to support our client, the Defense Security Cooperation University at WPAFB. This exciting opportunity will be a rewarding chance to learn and support our country in the Security Cooperation enterprise.
Description:
Research and develop significant knowledge of political, economic, social, cultural, physical, geographic, and military conditions of several foreign countries within the Combatant Commands
Assist regional leads in instructing military members and civilians going abroad
Provide students with research materials and relevant information on military training, funding, and weapons acquisition in countries going downrange
Invite/Host expert guest speakers that are pertinent to assigned combatant commands
Provide educational support for students and faculty for various Defense Security Cooperation University courses
Possess ability to work with Microsoft Office products
Qualifications:
To be considered for this position, you must be enrolled in a college program actively pursuing an associate’s, bachelor’s, or master’s degree
Desired but not required experience includes, political science, research experience, knowledge of foreign cultures, and the ability to work with others as a team.
Security Clearance:

This position will require U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance
ZENETEX is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Management Systems International (MSI), a Tetra Tech Company, is a Washington, D.C. metro area management consultancy with a 40-year history of delivering results for our clients. Our expertise is in the fields of monitoring and evaluation; democracy and governance; peace and stability; rule of law and accountability; education; gender and inclusion; strategic communications; and leadership and organizational development. MSI has implemented projects in 90 countries around the world such as Colombia, Indonesia, Jordan, Kenya, Mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, Syria and Ukraine, and works domestically. We support clients ranging from the U.S. Government (e.g., the U.S. Agency for International Development, U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Departments of State and Labor, and the Millennium Challenge Corporation) to large bilateral and multilateral donors (e.g., the World Bank and the United Nations Development Program). We also work with national and local governments, nongovernmental organizations (NGOs), think tanks, foundations and universities. For more information, please visit our website at www.msiworldwide.com.

**Please note: U.S. work authorization are required for this position.**

Position Summary:
The Technical Director (TD) will serve various functions within MSI depending upon the mix of projects, proposals and market development work at any given point of time, and their own interests and technical expertise. The TD will provide technical guidance for project implementation, proposals, and project design, and contribute substantially to client-focused technical work, and positioning MSI as an industry leader. The TD will be responsible for ensuring that the solutions we present to our clients are innovative, high quality, cost effective, and responsive to client needs. This position will be within the Peacebuilding and Governance Practice Area, with a particular focus on proposal technical design and direct proposal writing. The TD will be supervised by the Practice Area Director, but will regularly work in the context of teams, projects, and business development efforts that span multiple practice areas, including Rule of Law & Government Accountability. The preferred location for this role is in the Washington, DC Metropolitan area.

Responsibilities:
Business Development
Serve as technical lead (“Honcho”) or lead technical writer on USAID bid solicitations, ensuring effective coordination with MSI’s Business Development Unit during the proposal preparation process.
Provide technical expertise and oversight in the design, development, drafting, and review of project proposals.
Conduct field-based reconnaissance, recruitment, and research in support of proposal preparation.
Identify and track potential business development pursuits to effectively position and prepare MSI for anticipated bid solicitations.
Provide technical support to bid solicitations in other technical areas in the event there is a business need.

Technical Work
Provide both short- or long-term technical assistance to clients, as required in the context of MSI contractual mechanisms, including stand-alone projects and IDIQ mechanisms.
Stay abreast of developments in the peacebuilding and governance field.
Extract lessons learned, best practices and tools developed during project implementation and facilitate the packaging of experience for both internal use by MSI staff through existing knowledge management systems, and external audiences to advance thought leadership and market positioning.
Thought Leadership
Organize and participate in industry conferences, expert panels, committees, and events to develop contacts and foster professional relationships that will raise MSI’s profile as a prominent player in core peacebuilding and governance practice programing areas, including analytics, local governance and decentralization, public sector management, civil society, social accountability, stabilization, and conflict mitigation/peace-building, as relevant to the candidate’s specific technical expertise.
Prepare publications, such as articles, papers, blog posts or tools, and/or facilitate events that serve to position MSI as a thought leader on issues relevant to the Peacebuilding & Governance practice area.

Project Management
Provide technical support and oversight from headquarters on all technical issues impacting project design, development, and implementation, in consultation and coordination with field teams and other members of the headquarters project team.
Contribute to and oversee client reporting requirements.
Ensure submission of quality deliverables and overall client satisfaction.
Provide technical input on the financial and operational requirements of the project, including the design and management of the budget as it relates to technical implementation.
Conduct regular field visits to projects to provide technical expertise as needed, attend high profile events, meet with project staff and local partners, and establish direct relations with key donors including USAID and others, as part of overall technical management and oversight.
Provide mentorship and professional development opportunities to mid-level staff, including Technical Managers, Technical Associates, and Program Managers, in accordance with corporate mentorship initiatives.
Qualifications:
Master’s degree in political science, sociology, economics, political geography, social anthropology, public administration, conflict resolution/peacebuilding, international development, or related area is required.
Minimum 10 years of progressive work experience supporting donor funded DRG/Conflict-related programming, including in volatile, conflict-affected and/or fragile contexts.
Experience managing peacebuilding and governance USAID-funded projects.
Experience with field project implementation in fragile and/or conflict-affected states.
Ability to lead capture initiatives and technical writing for strategic company bids within key peacebuilding and governance technical areas.
Ability to work with diverse teams of technical, operational, and business development staff.
Ability to travel when required.
Fluency in written and oral English required. Fluency in Spanish, French, or Arabic preferred.

MSI Tetra Tech’s employees work together to comply with all applicable health & safety practices and protocols, including health orders and regulations related to COVID-19 that are mandated by local, state and federal authorities.

MSI is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We strive to develop and maintain a culture that honors the perspectives and identities of our employees, our communities and those impacted by our work.

Public Affairs - Strategic Communication Specialist - ( 230000NL )
Description
Many of the world’s top engineers and scientists come together in our Water business because they view a community’s interaction with water a bit differently—as a single holistic system, rather than unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. Working throughout the hydrologic cycle, we are delivering sustainable solutions to make sure water is where it should be and available when needed. Our experts guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Every day, we help communities improve, reuse, and protect this precious resource for future generations. By 2025 we’re hiring 2,000 people (like you) to join our team. Grow with us, H2O+U.
Your Opportunity
Stantec seeks a talented and entrepreneurial individual with substantial experience and a network of contacts focused on multi-party collaborative processes, disadvantaged community engagement, public policy review and analysis, public relations, and media relations. The selected candidate will be a strong writer who demonstrates a personal commitment to prepare and deliver messages and materials that help interested parties of different backgrounds and interests tangibly connect to complex and technical topics. Prior employers may include firms, agencies and companies that provide services in the fields of facilitation, mediation, public relations, government affairs, journalism, and other related fields, such as water resource planning, community development, political science, and public policy development.
Your Key Responsibilities
Plan and implement public information and public affairs programs.
Lead development and distribution of collateral materials drawn from technical reports, interviews, and independent research.
Lead planning, implementation, and facilitation of multi-party small- and large-scale meetings and forums in virtual and in-person formats.
Develop and manage social media, multimedia, and various web projects and programs.
Develop, implement, and analyze opinion polls/surveys, focus groups, and associated methods of surveying public opinion and perspectives.
Prepare grant and loan proposals on behalf of local public agencies.
Coordinate and consult with clients, regulatory agencies, and subcontractors.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education, Experience, and Credentials
Master’s or bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in journalism, public relations, agricultural communications, political science, English, or a closely related field. Professional experience serving as a technical facilitator may be a substitute for coursework in an unrelated field.
Five or more years professional experience.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with a demonstrated ability to adapt to different audiences.
Strong interpersonal and entrepreneurial abilities and a proven track record for working independently was well as part of a diverse team of staff, clients, and interested parties.
Demonstrated ability to lead and management projects and teams, including supervision of direct reports.
Experience in the following subject matter areas preferred, but not required
California water resources (including river systems/water-related infrastructure and applicable laws/policies/regulations) and federal planning processes.
Surface water, groundwater, and recycled water supply projects.
Flood management and conveyance.
Natural resource management and environmental restoration.
Western U.S. water resources industry, infrastructure and applicable laws, policies, and regulations.
California Native American Tribes, environmental justice, and disadvantaged communities.
Experience in the following technical areas preferred, but not required
Technical writing and editing of complex integrated water resource programs and projects.
Major marketing campaigns and new business development.
Multimedia marketing and advertising campaigns.
Fluent in Spanish (written and spoken)
Interested candidates are asked to send: 1) Letter of interest, 2) Resume or CV, and 3) written descriptions (up to 200 words) for up to three projects or programs for which the candidate views as ideal representation of their role and responsibility applicable to this position.
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required. Other activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. The experience will forever shape your future.

JOB DESCRIPTION
POSITION SUMMARY: The Legal Administrative Assistant will support the Legal and Risk Management department through a full range of clerical and administrative duties. Reporting to the General Counsel, they will work closely with all members of the Legal and Risk Management team as well as key members of other departments.
The Legal Administrative Assistant is a self-motivated and detail-oriented professional, who plays an integral role in the day-to-day operations of the Legal department. An adaptable and flexible team player, the Legal Admin will use their strong self-starter skills to take ownership and prioritize assigned projects, meeting deadlines and communicating appropriately.
Due to the duties and scope of this position, the assignment will be fully in-office.
Salary Range: $50,000 - $70,000 annually
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist with active project administrative support by creating and sending start-up kits and dispersing employment posters to jobsite field offices.
Manage and track documentation, including copying, scanning, filing, and archiving.
Actively seek ways to use technology to improve efficiency, while maintaining exceptional compliance with all federal, state, local, and company regulations, policies, and laws.
Coordinate and set up conference rooms, transcribe meeting minutes, organize and disperse departmental mail, manage department email accounts, schedule meetings, and make travel arrangements for the Legal and Risk Management Department.
Assist with legal filings and documentation related to business and employment practices as assigned.
Support multiple attorneys with discovery management and organizing documentation for litigation on an as-needed basis.
Provide backup support for various functions within the department and other areas of the business outside the department with cross training.
Assist with federal, state, and local-level compliance-related tasks.
Assist the Risk Management team with general insurance needs, including requesting insurance policies and certificates from outside parties, providing insurance certificates to outside parties, and completing application and request forms as assigned.
Assist the Drug and Alcohol Testing Administrator with tracking post-accident testing and results as needed.
QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Key Competencies:
Instills Trust: The Legal Administrative Assistant must gain the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity and authenticity.
Ensures Accountability: The Legal Administrative Assistant takes ownership and responsibility for their decisions and actions and holds themselves accountable for meeting the commitments that they have made.
Situational Adaptability: The Legal Administrative Assistant adapts their approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.
Tech Savvy: The Legal Administrative Assistant actively searches for technical options that can improve business or personal performance, and readily learns and adopts new technologies.
Education
High School diploma or equivalent required.
Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
Experience
Minimum of two (2) years of experience in a professional office setting required.
Professional experience in a legal setting preferred.
Position Related Skills
Proficient in Windows and Microsoft Office 365 (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and Teams), and have a general understanding of working within a computer network.
Working knowledge of legal research databases preferred.
Experience with Relativity, Access, or other document management systems preferred.
Excellent time-management skills with the ability to seamlessly move between tasks and shift priorities.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with an ability to develop strong interpersonal relationships.
Ability to work well in a large professional setting. Patience and professionalism are essential.
Must be a strong team player with the ability to collaborate with various personnel within and across departments and at all levels of leadership.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
The ability to identify a problem and effectively analyze the situation and suggest a resolution.
Able to effectively handle sensitive and confidential information.
Able to work effectively as part of a team.
Able to work well under pressure.
Must be able to work independently, make decisions, and follow through on all assignments.
Bilingual in English/Spanish preferred.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Must be able to remain in a stationary position in an office environment more than 50% of the time.
Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, or printer.
The worker is required to have the ability to perform duties such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; reading printed and digital documents.
Constantly required to communicate with customers and coworkers in an office setting, on the phone, and in digital meetings.
Ability to communicate laws, ordinances, plans, regulations, protocols, directives, and standard operating procedures.
The majority of work is performed in an office setting, with minimal time spent outdoors in all types of weather conditions and exposure.
Constant mental alertness, accuracy, and attention to detail required.
Application review will consider without limitation the following criteria: qualifications, education, and experience specific to the job description/duties as well as prior experience with Hoffman Construction. Applicants must be able to pass the Hoffman Drug and Alcohol test.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

We're on the lookout for a Communications Campaign Coordinator. The role is uniquely positioned to impact our client and education communities in the state of Michigan. This role supports fast-paced, multi-client campaigns to help K-12 public school districts pass bond election proposals.

Why Work with us?

Opportunity for All.

That's the world GMB strives to see. Our integrated team of educational planners, architects, and engineers are just one part of the learning ecosystem that will make that happen.
GMB believes education provides transformational opportunities for our communities, industries, and our world. We are all in. Will you join us?
As a learning organization structured for ideation, innovation and sharing of knowledge, GMB has hubs of experts in Grand Rapids, Holland, and Royal Oak, Michigan, and Indianapolis, Indiana, and education projects throughout the Midwest.
As a Communications Campaign Coordinator with GMB you will:
Develop and implement campaign communication strategies for external client projects.
Work closely with internal and external teams to align campaign communication plans with campaign goals.
Work closely with the campaign planning team, K-12 Practice Lead, and internal teams to develop content for the web and social media to elevate campaigns.
Draft op-eds, press releases, fact sheets, mailings, and other materials.
Join a team of professionals who are passionate about the growth of education in our communities.
Interact with clients through meetings and discussions.
Travel throughout Michigan as needed. GMB's ample flexibility options will be available to help balance travel and work hours outside of a standard 8:00 - 5:00 schedule.
We might be a great match for each other if you have:
3+ years of professional experience / robust internship experience in one or more of the following areas: media, strategic communications, digital communications, public relations, or professional experience working on electoral or advocacy campaigns
Excellent verbal and writing skills; ability to communicate persuasively and professionally in writing to a wide variety of media, stakeholder, influencer audiences, and voters
Experience writing op-eds, blog posts, and social media posts on tight deadlines
Knowledge of current political and media landscapes.
It would also be great if you are:
Able to build, manage, and sustain relationships with media outlets throughout the state of Michigan to increase media coverage of client bond election campaigns
Familiar with graphic design programs and have an understanding and working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite.
A strategic thinker, self-directed, and have experience speaking to diverse audiences.
What you might also like to know is that:
We're an employee-owned company. This means that 100% of the ownership at GMB is held by us as employees. Our creativity, skills, and expertise have a direct impact on our value and growth. Your role as a teammate will have a direct impact on the company's actions and result in a share in its profits.
GMB doesn't operate within a hierarchical pyramid structure; instead, we operate like a network of teams that come together around specific goals working toward our overarching purpose. We think this is a better way to work and help everyone reach their potential.
Finally, at GMB we embrace a flexible workplace that empowers each person to decide where and how they work best. Our inclusive, people-first culture encourages teams to collaborate, communicate and find fulfillment personally and professionally, regardless of location or schedule.
This is a direct hire, full time position. Salary will be commensurate with experience, including an excellent benefit package. Must have current and continuing right to work in the United States without sponsorship. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

Description:
HELIX Environmental Planning, Inc. (HELIX), a growing, employee-owned California-based environmental consulting and planning firm, is currently seeking as-needed archaeologists for our Cultural Resources Division. HELIX offers environmental, biological, cultural resources, acoustical, air quality, and GIS services to both the public and private sectors. Candidate must be willing and able to work for extended work rotations on the Channel Islands.
As-Needed Archaeologist responsibilities may include conducting or overseeing and background research, field surveys, excavation (testing and data recovery), construction monitoring, coordination with Native American tribes and representatives, laboratory studies (cleaning, sorting, and cataloging artifacts), and preparing reports. Candidate must be a qualified archaeologist under the Secretary of the Interior’s standards; comfortable with working in remote areas for extended periods of time; have knowledge of the archaeology and culture history of coastal California; have direct and demonstrable experience conducting archaeological work on the Channel Islands; possess excellent writing and communication skills; and be self-motivated. Candidates must be able to work independently with considerable responsibility and have a positive attitude.
HELIX is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of gender, race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, family status, or veteran status.
Hourly wages will be based on qualifications and/or experience. Expected starting pay range of $30 to $60 per hour.
HELIX is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and an inclusive work environment. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, disability, age, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service or veteran status. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring, appraisal systems, promotions, training, and career development programs.
PM21
#archaeology #fieldsurveys #archaeologist #anthropology #culturalresources
Requirements:
Minimum Requirements for Archaeologist:
Master’s degree in Anthropology, Archaeology, or a closely related field
Experience with performing archaeological studies on California Channel Islands
Experience with Tribal coordination and consultation
Knowledge of the archaeology and cultural history of coastal California
Experience with GPS equipment
Possess excellent written/verbal communication skills
Possess a valid California Driver’s License and 3 years clean driving record
Ability to pass a military background check
Additional skills considered a plus:
Experience managing medium- to large-scale cultural resource management projects
Supervisory experience managing teams on archaeology projects
Experience applying Section 106 of the National Historic Preservation Act
Field experience on military installations
Familiarity with the Native American Graves and Repatriation Act
Artifact illustration

Description:
Position Summary:
The International Code Council (ICC) is a member-focused association dedicated to helping the building community and the construction industry provide safe, resilient, and sustainable construction through the development and use of model codes (I-Codes) and standards used in the design, construction, and compliance processes. Most U.S. states and communities, federal agencies, and many global markets choose the I-Codes to set the standards for regulating construction, plumbing and sanitation, fire prevention, and energy conservation in the built environment. In addition to its codes and standards activities, the Code Council provides product testing and evaluation, accreditation, software and technology, professional development and training, and consulting services solutions for governments and businesses. The Code Council has roughly 64,000 members across nearly 400 state, local, and regional chapters.
Reporting to the Lead Senior Government Relations (GR) Regional Manager, the GR Regional Manager develops, manages, and directs ICC’s state and local priorities within their assigned geographic region, the focus of which will be in California. This position is charged with creating and advancing regulatory and legislative policies and business opportunities at the state and local level across the assigned region that impact the building codes ICC develops and the broader Code Council Family of Solutions (FoS).
In the assigned region, the GR Regional Manager acts as primary liaison for state and local governmental entities, stakeholders, and ICC Chapters, working on activities that impact the building codes ICC develops and the broader ICC FoS. Within this region, the GR Regional Manager will be responsible for developing and fostering relationships with elected officials and policy makers in all branches of government as well as in the private sector and using those relationships and opportunities to shape and guide policies that impact or are of relevance to ICC’s members and the ICC FoS.
A successful candidate will demonstrate strong written and oral communication, time management, attention to detail, and organizational skills; an in-depth understanding of state and local legislative and regulatory processes and member organization activities and interests; the ability to collaborate and work effectively on a team, be proactive, and to work under deadline to achieve established goals.
Position Responsibilities:Build relationships and serve as a liaison with ICC members and chapters;Represent ICC at member meetings, conferences, and trade shows;Draft legislative proposals and strategies; responses to rulemakings and other administrative actions; and fact sheets, bill summaries, and other materials for decision-makers, ICC members, and the public;Testify and prepare testimony for legislative and administrative bodies;Develop, manage and leverage relationships with coalitions of stakeholders including state agencies, county and municipal organizations, ICC members, and other interested parties;Monitor and report on state and local legislation and administrative actions, and analyze political climates and trends, including state and local elections;Prepare lobbying disclosures and filings for assigned territory;Prepare annual cost center budget, manage cost center budget and track expenditures to ensure compliance with approved budget;Prepare and make presentations to state and local government officials, design professionals, contractors, and other interested parties on all aspects of the ICC FoS;Assist with special projects as assigned and maintain data on pursuit of departmental goals in assigned territory;Work with ICC’s federal relations staff to capture federal opportunities at the state and local levels;Develop and execute team and individual state and local plans, pivoting as necessary, to further the goals of ICC and FoS, national strategy, and other organizational priorities including code adoption, implementation, and usage of FoS products and services;Other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Recommended Qualifications:Mid- to senior-level experience (minimum of 5 years experience).Strong existing relationships and network of key decision-makers and contacts relevant to ICC and the ICC FoS within California.Proactive prioritizer with a demonstrated history of working under deadlines to achieve established goals.Expertise in state and local legislative and regulatory processes and experience with member associations.Experience working on resilience/disaster mitigation, wildfire/life safety, conservation/sustainability, and/or construction industry issues is preferred.Familiarity with Microsoft 365 applications, including Word, Excel, OneDrive, SharePoint, Teams, Outlook, and PowerPoint is required.Ability to travel (up to 50%) is required.Home office within California is required.

We are looking for a full-time Legal Assistant.Our company offers our employees a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package which includes health benefits, paid vacation, 401k match, and others.

Description:

Herbert, Rowland & Grubic, Inc. (HRG) is an employee-owned, nationally ranked design firm providing civil engineering, surveying, and environmental services to the private and public sectors.
We are actively seeking a Municipal Consulting and Management Strategist, specializing in Local Government and Authority Management/Consulting, to join our dedicated team of professionals in Lehigh Valley, PA. As the Municipal Consulting and Management Strategist, key responsibilities include:
Perform and manage stormwater authorities/utilities projects.Facilitate community-based collaborations for stormwater program implementation.Support the development of regional services management plans and programs for municipal and County clients.Assist clients with formulizing/creating municipal authorities/utilities.Support Strategic Financial and Management Planning services for local government and authority clients.Support annual budget and benchmarking development for local government and authority clients.Evaluate the financial impacts on the capital and operating costs of utility projects by engineering and financing principles.Assist clients in implementing rates, developing revenue streams, and securing financing for capital improvement projects.Assist HRG’s IT and Geomatics divisions with implementing technology solutions to support local, county, and authority clients.Participate in marketing activities to internal and external prospective clients.Manage project profitability.
Requirements:
Bachelors of Science Degree in Engineering, Political Science, Public Policy, Public Administration, Business Administration, or Accounting.Minimum 7 years of experience in local government management, municipal finance director role, or consulting engineering.Knowledge of municipality class codes and Municipality Authorities ActClient-focused leader and team player possessing strong communication, strategic planning, and organizational skillsMust be a self-starter, independent worker, team member with strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skillsProficient in Microsoft Office Suite to include Excel, Word, Power Point, and OutlookValid driver licenseRequires travel to daytime and evening clients’ meetings, and travel to other HRG officesHas the legal right to work in the U.S.
Life at HRG
Are you a creative problem solver who wants to make a difference in people’s everyday lives? Find out why it’s #Good2bHRG :
Work with Purpose & Impact: Our people design roads, bridges, water and sewer systems. They reduce pollution and protect environmental resources. They prepare sites for new homes, businesses, schools, and gathering spaces. They develop strategic plans and connect leaders to the funding they need to turn vision into reality. Join us, and use your talent to enhance safety, promote health and well-being, connect people and places, and build strong economies in the community around you.
100% Employee Ownership: Every member of the team shares in the firm’s financial success through the company-funded employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), but ownership means so much more to us at HRG. It’s about communicating transparently, being accessible, and empowering everyone to contribute their ideas.
Bright Opportunities for Growth: HRG has experienced steady annual growth over the past decade, adding new services and new territories across the tri-state area. We have a detailed path to continue that growth in the decade to come, and our people are the foundation of that plan. We provide ample training, mentorship, and peer networking opportunities, so you can continue to evolve your skills and take on new challenges.
Freedom and Flexibility to Define Where and When You Work: You have many goals: professional and personal. At HRG, you’ll be able to pursue them all. Our team has incredible flexibility to adjust their schedule around their life, start the weekend early with Half-Day Fridays, and do their work at home, in the office or any combination they choose.
Comprehensive Benefits, including medical, dental, vision, short- and long-term disability, life insurance for you and your dependents, general paid leave, and more.
Fun, Supportive Environment: HRG has a One Company mindset focused on collaboration and shared success, not competition. Our founders set out to create an enjoyable workplace, and their vision continues today with regular potlucks, picnic lunches, team building retreats, and friendly games.
National-Recognition: HRG was the ENR 2021 MidAtlantic Design Firm of the Year, and we have received numerous awards at both the regional and national level. See more on our website
Best Place to Work: HRG was recognized as one of the 2021 Best Places to Work in PA.
Learn more about us at www.hrg-inc.com/careers and Visit us on LinkedIn to see our culture, our projects, and even more reasons why it’s #Good2bHRG

Who We Are

Balfour Beatty Investments is a global infrastructure investor operating in the UK, US, and Canada. We provide the investment capability to deliver complex infrastructure projects. Over the past 15 years, Balfour Beatty Investments (formerly known as Balfour Beatty Capital) has established itself as one of the largest investors in the PPP industry, building a portfolio of more than 60 projects worldwide, predominantly in the UK and US.

Balfour Beatty Investments is proud to offer challenging and rewarding work in a variety of functional areas. As a company, we operate with safety and sustainability as our primary focus. Equally integral components of our culture are our values—Integrity, Teamwork, Excellence, Respect—and our code of conduct. Living up to these commitments requires the fresh ideas, insights and talents of employees as diverse as the audiences we interact with every day.
The success of our company is built on the efforts of our employees. We are committed to offering our employees a path to professional success through development, training and mentoring opportunities that cover a wide variety of skills and functional areas.

At Balfour Beatty Investments, our employees are our greatest asset, and their well-being means a healthier, more productive workplace. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes a variety of health care options, retirement benefits and other flexible benefits.

Our Benefits

Discretionary bonuses
Medical and Dental Insurance 1st of the month following employment
Health, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts
Company paid life insurance
401K plan with employer matching
Robust PTO to include, sick, floating holidays, vacation, and personal days
2 Volunteer Days per year
Company paid short-term and long- term disability, parental leave.
And more!

About the role

The SVP, Government Relations Advisor will represent the Company on federal legislative and regulatory issues, serving as a registered lobbyist in advocating favorable federal legislative and regulatory positions for the Company and the industry.
This position offers a unique opportunity to benefit from the Company s competitive benefits, participate in legislative and regulatory activity in Washington, D.C. and function in an entrepreneurial environment. This is a new position and the incumbent will be responsible to lead and setup this new office.
What you'll be doing

Provide depth and expertise in support of Washington D.C. based legislative and regulatory affairs efforts by building and maintaining relationships on behalf of the Company with key members of Congress, congressional staff, and administration.
Educate Congress on the Military Family Housing Privatization program and what the Company is doing to support military members and their families.
Attend Congressional hearings, briefings and meetings and prepare summaries of legislative, regulatory, and political developments of interest to the Company.
Actively build and manage relationships with consultants, think tanks and trade associations to improve service and reduce costs; while identifying areas of operational risk which can be minimized and maximizing the benefit and positive exposure for the Company.
Provide recommendations related to developing and managing political activities consistent with emerging election trends in advance of each election cycle to best serve the organization s business objectives.
Draft and circulate periodic legislative updates, and conduct presentations to keep Company informed and engaged in the legislative process.
Routinely work with Company executives to formulate policy.
Establish and maintain a professional network of political, lobbying, campaign and public policy contacts to maintain the profile of the Company with federal legislators, congressional staff, and trade associations.

Who we're looking for

Law degree, M.B.A. or relevant graduate degree preferred.
5 – 10 years of relevant experience in political, public policy, campaign, or lobbying areas or combination with a focus on insurance, banking, financial services industry, or related field.
Must have experience with annual Congressional appropriations and defense authorization process. Preferable to have knowledge of DoD organization and decision-making process.
Must be able to recommend positions on issues and suggest changes in strategies as legislative and regulatory processes unfold – acute political and public perception sensitivity.
Demonstrate strong decision-making skills with a solid foundation of analytical and strategic thinking.
Demonstrated ability to write efficiently for a c-suite audience, under tight deadlines.
Must have a clear reputation for ethical conduct.
Proven self-starter, results oriented with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication skills in written, verbal and interpersonal communications skills a must.
Represent the Company at all times in a professional manner and in accordance with all corporate policies and all applicable ethics, lobbying, gift and campaign finance rules, laws, and regulations.
Established relationships on Capitol Hill.
Registered as a lobbyist.
Proficient knowledge of legislative processes.
Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written.
Outstanding people skills.
Ability to influence others.
Available to attend events and meetings outside work hours.
Possession of a valid state issues driver s license and safe driving record are required

Description
Do you want to work at a company where the employee-owners genuinely care about each other and foster a collaborative environment?
Do you want to be part of a team that does great work on a wide variety of projects that are important to your community?
Does your dream job include preparing meaningful historic resource evaluations, or crafting creative mitigation for the preservation of historic structures under CEQA or NEPA?
Are you excited about having a say about the kinds of built environment projects your company pursues? Then HELIX is the perfect fit for you!
HELIX Environmental Planning, Inc., a growing, California-based environmental consulting firm, is seeking a Senior Architectural Historian to join its Cultural Resources team. HELIX offers cultural resources, environmental, biological, acoustical, air quality, and GIS services to both the public and private sectors. Our cultural resources staff completes a variety of historic preservation, studies for a wide range of local, state, and federal projects.
Why work at HELIX?
Employee-owned since 2004
Offers a hybrid work schedule with flexibility of working in-office and remotely

We can be VERY flexible! While we are searching for a full-time candidate, we are also open to the possibility of a part-time candidate. You can choose to work out of one of our six office locations in California, or you can work fully remote or a mix of both! Just tell us what works for you!
The successful candidate will lead built environment studies for a wide range of project types throughout California, reporting office to be determined based on work location. Responsibilities will include proposal preparation, research, field reconnaissance, historic-era building/site/object evaluations, impact analyses, Historic Assessment/HABS/HAER/HALS report preparation, and communication with other cultural resources and environmental planning staff, subconsultants, clients, and agency staff. The ideal candidate will have knowledge and training in historical resources of California, with at least eight years of related experience. Knowledge of the California historical, environmental, and regulatory setting is required.
Candidates must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and analytical abilities. The applicant must have a strong work ethic, positive attitude, and work well with others. The role does not require supervision of other staff.
Salary will be based on qualifications and/or experience, with a robust benefits package. Expected starting pay range of $93,000 to $124,000 (pro-rated for part-time).
HELIX is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and an inclusive work environment. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, disability, age, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service or veteran status. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring, appraisal systems, promotions, training, and career development programs.

Requirements
Minimum Requirements for Senior Architectural Historian:
 Graduate degree in historic or architectural preservation, art history, American architectural history, preservation planning, or a closely related field
A minimum of eight years of professional experience in applying the methods and practices of historic preservation in the identification, evaluation, and treatment of historic resources
Strong research, writing, organizational, and verbal communication skills
Knowledge and experience with historic preservation and cultural resources management in California; and
Knowledge of the federal and California laws and regulations pertaining to cultural resource protection and management, and the ability to evaluate compliance with relevant federal and state regulations, policies, and procedures pertaining to resources eligible for inclusion in the National Register of Historic Places and California Register of Historical Resources.
Experience with development/implementation of research designs, preservation plans, and mitigation measures (e.g., HABS/HAER documentation)
Additional skills considered a plus for Senior Architectural Historian:
Historic archaeology experience and capabilities
Experience with development/implementation of construction monitoring plans and programs
Experience in the marketing of historic resource services

Description:
Do you want to work at a company where the employee-owners genuinely care about each other and foster a collaborative environment?
Do you want to be part of a team that does great work on a wide variety of projects that are important to your community?
Does your dream job include preparing meaningful historic resource evaluations, or crafting creative mitigation for the preservation of historic structures under CEQA or NEPA?
Are you excited about having a say about the kinds of built environment projects your company pursues? Then HELIX is the perfect fit for you!
HELIX Environmental Planning, Inc., a growing, California-based environmental consulting firm, is seeking a Senior Architectural Historian to join its Cultural Resources team. HELIX offers cultural resources, environmental, biological, acoustical, air quality, and GIS services to both the public and private sectors. Our cultural resources staff completes a variety of historic preservation, studies for a wide range of local, state, and federal projects.

SmithGroup is an award-winning, multinational integrated design firm with a team of 1,300 experts across 19 offices in the U.S. and China. We employ research, data, advanced technologies and design thinking to help clients solve their greatest challenges. Our specialists?develop beautiful, sustainable, future-focused solutions for healthcare providers, science and technology organizations, higher education and cultural institutions, urban environments, diverse workplaces, mixed-use and waterfront developments, and parks and open spaces. We are deeply committed to our promise to Design a Better Future - for our clients, communities and employees. Are you ready to help us get there?
The Madison office of SmithGroup is looking for a Grant Development Specialist to join our team.?
The Grant Development Specialist will play a key role in helping advance projects and positioning the firm to secure new business opportunities. This role will be responsible for the research and development of grant and philanthropic funding opportunities across private and public sectors. Working with leadership from multiple SmithGroup offices and markets, the Grant Development Specialist will support firm growth and client funding needs.
The position may be located in any of the following SmithGroup offices: Ann Arbor, Michigan; Chicago, Illinois; Detroit, Michigan; Madison, Wisconsin; Milwaukee, Wisconsin; or Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The Grant Development Specialist will report to the Director of Operations in an affiliated office.
Working with us, you will:
Focus on the research and development of public and private grant and philanthropic funding opportunities and the coordination and development of grant submissions.
Research grant-awarding organizations and prioritize opportunities for SmithGroup and clients.
Draft, review, and submit grant proposals and supporting documents based on the funding requirements of projects on behalf of clients and firm.
Create and maintain relationships with funding agencies.
Serve as a funding expert related to funding sources available for certain markets and geographies and advise the team on potential opportunities related to projects/clients.
Assists in the development and implementation of outreach strategies to educate clients on potential project funding.
Drafts grant and funding-related content related to marketing collateral, proposals and presentations.
Develop methodology to measure the success of grants awarded and funding obtained.
May support community meetings or other public forums including scheduling and coordination.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Political Science, Marketing, Communications, English, Journalism or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in grant writing.
Knowledge of the AEC Industry preferred.
Microsoft Office Suite experience is required.
Adobe InDesign experience is preferred.

SmithGroup offers competitive compensation and an excellent benefit package, including 401(k) and wellbeing resources. We promote a healthy work/life balance for our staff which includes an alternative work schedule that provides employees with an additional 15 days off per year (usually Fridays), as well as hybrid options that give our team flexibility to work within our vibrant office culture or remotely, as needed. We also offer paid time off that is immediately available to new hires, 8 paid federal holidays, and parental leave benefits.?
